title: Android Weekly Issue #624
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored At Google I/O AI is the future & the future is now At I/O 2024, Google announced substantial updates to Jetpack Compose and Kotlin Multiplatform, as well as the second beta of Android 15. But if there was anything they really wanted to get across, it’s that AI is the future, this future is right now, and you love this and are thrilled it’s happening. Google Bets on Kotlin Multiplatform: Koin Leads for Android & KMP The Koin crew takes a closer look at Google's announcement to support KMP on Android. Injecting Composables with Dagger without losing it Costa Fotiadis helps work around some challenges when using Dagger with Composables. Sponsored Modern mobile observability based on OpenTelemetry Finally, a common language across DevOps and mobile dev teams. With the only open source, OpenTelemetry SDKs specialized for mobile, you can modernize your observability practice with critical mobile signals from real users. The days of siloed tools that don’t share a common set of telemetry are over. Learn more about how to integrate the new OTel SDKs from Embrace today. Exploring Shared Element Transition with Navigation in Compose Megh Lath dives into navigating elegantly, with a hands-on shared element exploration. Kotlin Multiplatform State of the Art Survey 2024 Snapp Mobile presents the results of the Kotlin Multiplatform Developer Survey 2024, which aims to shed light on the state of Kotlin Multiplatform development in 2024. Caching Strategies in Android Zsolt Bertalan analyzes some approaches to caching on Android. KotlinConf 2024 announcements Enrique López-Mañas analyzes some of the announcements from KotlinConf 2024. Exploring the Compose Preview Screenshot Testing tool Joe Birch experiments with support for Compose Preview Screenshot Testing using the Compose Preview Screenshot Testing tool. Random Musings on the Android 15 Beta 2 Mark Murphy rummages through the API differences report for Android 15 Beta 2. Down a Rabbit Hole Romain Guy continues this series of articles on Kotlin optimizations, adding a test for intersecting/overlapping rectangles. Effortless Compose Compiler report analysis Shreyas Patil shows how to make your Compose app perform well with as few recompositions as possible. Change App Theme - Personalizing Accessibility Eevis Panula continues the series of articles on personalizing accessibility, this time sharing concrete examples A Developer’s Roadmap to Predictive Back (Views) This blog post aims to shed light on various dependencies and requirements to support predictive back animations in your views based app. Amper Update May 2024 Márton Braun looks at a brand-new way of using Amper, to see how the tooling has improved recently, and what’s new in Amper 0.3.0. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code ComposeGuard A Gradle plugin for detecting regressions in Jetpack Compose soil Compose-First Power Packs for Kotlin Multiplatform and Android News Celebrating Kotlin 2.0: Fast, Smart, and Multiplatform JetBrains has released Kotlin 2.0 with a stable K2 compiler, which is multiplatform from the ground up, understands your code better, and compiles it twice as fast. A Look Inside Multiplatform Development with KMP and more Google participated in KotlinConf 2024, the next moment to share the highlights and connect with the Kotlin community. Streamline Data Analysis with Kotlin DataFrame Tables in Notebooks JetBrains introduces a new UI component in Kotlin DataFrame 0.13.1, which enhances your data exploration experience inside the Kotlin Notebook plugin. Compose Multiplatform 1.6.10 – Lifecycle, Navigation, and More Compose Multiplatform 1.6.10 release includes several powerful features and upgrades iOS support to Beta and Web support to Alpha. Videos & Podcasts mDevCamp 2024 mDevCamp 2024 in Prague Congress Centre, April 23, 2024 Developing Soft/Transferable Skills for a sustainable Tech Career Sumaiya Nalukwago delves into the power of transferable skills, often overlooked gems you possess from various experiences, even outside the tech realm. Debug Your Jetpack Compose UIs Effortlessly! Charfaoui Younes shows an amazing library that will allow you to check recompositions and various aspects of your Jetpack Compose UIs. How to Use the Google's New Screenshot Testing Framework for Compose Philipp Lackner shows how to use Google's New Screenshot Testing Framework for Compose! Google for Games 2024 Playlist of several presentations from Google for Games 2024. Building your first Desktop app with Kotlin/Compose Multiplatform Learn how to build your first Desktop app (Windows, Mac, Linux) using Kotlin/Compose Multiplatform. Make it faster Romain and Tor talk with Fabien Sanglard from the Android Studio team on his work to improve the debug stack -- including the new USB speed detection feature recently unveiled at Google I/O.

But if there was anything they really wanted to get across, it’s that AI is the future, this future is right now, and you love this and are thrilled it’s happening. A Gradle plugin for detecting regressions in Jetpack Compose Compose-First Power Packs for Kotlin Multiplatform and Android mDevCamp 2024 in Prague Congress Centre, April 23, 2024 Romain and Tor talk with Fabien Sanglard from the Android Studio team on his work to improve the debug stack -- including the new USB speed detection feature recently unveiled at Google I/O. ]]>
html:
At I/O 2024, Google announced substantial updates to Jetpack Compose and Kotlin Multiplatform, as well as the second beta of Android 15. But if there was anything they really wanted to get across, it’s that AI is the future, this future is right now, and you love this and are thrilled it’s happening.

Finally, a common language across DevOps and mobile dev teams. With the only open source, OpenTelemetry SDKs specialized for mobile, you can modernize your observability practice with critical mobile signals from real users. The days of siloed tools that don’t share a common set of telemetry are over. Learn more about how to integrate the new OTel SDKs from Embrace today.

Romain Guy continues this series of articles on Kotlin optimizations, adding a test for intersecting/overlapping rectangles.

Márton Braun looks at a brand-new way of using Amper, to see how the tooling has improved recently, and what’s new in Amper 0.3.0.

A Gradle plugin for detecting regressions in Jetpack Compose

Compose-First Power Packs for Kotlin Multiplatform and Android

mDevCamp 2024 in Prague Congress Centre, April 23, 2024

Romain and Tor talk with Fabien Sanglard from the Android Studio team on his work to improve the debug stack -- including the new USB speed detection feature recently unveiled at Google I/O.

]]>
